identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Assess Serotonin Transporter Occupancy of Healthy Adults Using 11C-DASB PET
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Non-Randomized, Open-Label, Exploratory Mechanistic Validation (PoM) Clinical Trial of LV232 Capsule Assessing Serotonin Transporter Occupancy in the Healthy Adult Brain Using 11C-DASB Positron Emission Tomography (PET)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study was a non-randomized, open-label clinical study to assess Serotonin transporter occupancy in the brain of healthy adults using 11C-DASB positron emission tomography (PET)
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study was a non-randomized, open-label clinical study to assess Serotonin transporter occupancy in the brain of healthy adults using 11C-DASB positron emission tomography (PET).LV232 capsules were administered as single oral doses of 40mg and the PET scans were performed at screening and about 3h after administration. The positive drug group escitalopram was established at a single dosing of 20mg based on an evaluation of the occupancy obtained data from LV232 capsule cohorts.

armGroups.label: LV232
armGroups.description: A single oral dose of 40mg LV232 (5 mg/capsule, 8 capsules each time) ，administrated in fasting state, with 240 mL water to take

armGroups.label: Escitalopram
armGroups.description: A single oral dose of 20mg Escitalopram (10 mg/tablet, 2 tablets each time) , administrated with 240 mL water

primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of Serotonin Transporters Occupancy in Human Brain after oral LV232 capsule
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline and 3 hours after administration on Day 1
